summary: A message from DCSI USCOB Berlin to DPSI USAREUR Heidelberg regarding two possible US Army deserters, Peter Simons and Roman Arnold, believed to be in West Berlin. The message details their background, reported activities, and planned actions for apprehension, including coordination with West Berlin police and immediate air transport to avoid publicity.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 2, 1967, DCSI USCOB Berlin sent a confidential message to DPSI USAREUR Heidelberg concerning two possible US Army deserters, Peter Simons and Roman Arnold, suspected to be in West Berlin. The message relays information from West Berlin and Dusseldorf police indicating the deserters, who expressed a desire to avoid service in Vietnam, were registered in the French sector and associated with a student organization known for assisting military personnel in deserting to neutral countries. The message outlines planned actions for apprehending Simons and Arnold, including involving West Berlin police accompanied by US military police, and arranging immediate air transport to Rhein Main to mitigate potential adverse publicity and student demonstrations, with ongoing efforts to ascertain their citizenship and the identities of those aiding them.
title: MESSAGE
